lead_paragraph: Arthur E. Holch Jr., an Emmy Award-winning television documentarian whose work at midcentury and afterward tackled charged subjects like race relations, Nazism and Communism, died on Sept. 23 in Greenwich, Conn. He was 86 and a longtime Greenwich resident. The cause was heart failure, his family said.
snippet: Mr. Holch won an Emmy in 1992 for a documentary on Hitler youth, but his most famous documentary depicted the daily lives of blacks in 1961.
abstract: Arthur E Holch Jr, Emmy Award-winning television documentarian whose work tackled charged subjects like race relations, Nazism and Communism, dies at age 86; photo (M)
